predictions.text: U.S. CPI (headline, MoM, seasonally adjusted) for September 2025 will print between 0.1% and 0.3% in the BLS release on 2025-10-10.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify in BLS CPI News Release (Table 1), CPI-U U.S. city average, seasonally adjusted percent change, 'All items' for September 2025 is within [0.1%, 0.3%].
predictions.rationale: Energy softness and easing core goods offset sticky shelter; nowcasts cluster around low-0.2%.

predictions.text: U.S. core CPI (all items less food and energy, MoM, SA) for September 2025 will print between 0.2% and 0.3% in the BLS release on 2025-10-10.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify in BLS CPI News Release (Table 1), CPI-U 'All items less food and energy', seasonally adjusted percent change for September 2025 is within [0.2%, 0.3%].
monitoring_signals: Core goods pricing (apparel, vehicles, household goods)
predictions.rationale: Shelter deceleration and tame core goods keep core MoM near 0.2–0.3%.

predictions.text: Seasonally adjusted U.S. continuing jobless claims will print at or above 1.90 million in at least one weekly DOL Unemployment Insurance report published by 2025-11-15.
predictions.verification_criteria: In any DOL Unemployment Insurance Weekly Claims news release by the deadline, the seasonally adjusted 'Insured unemployment' (continued claims) value is ≥ 1,900,000.
predictions.rationale: Cooling labor demand and rising duration of unemployment lift continuing claims.

predictions.text: The Cboe Volatility Index (VIX) will close at or below 12.00 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Any official Cboe VIX closing value on cboe.com at or below 12.00 by the deadline.
monitoring_signals: Macro event risk (CPI, FOMC, payrolls) outcomes
predictions.rationale: Benign macro surprises and strong liquidity can compress implied vol episodically.

predictions.text: The U.S. 10-Year Treasury yield (FRED: DGS10) will close at or above 4.60% on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: FRED series DGS10 daily close ≥ 4.60% on any trading day by the deadline.
monitoring_signals: Fed guidance and term premium proxies
predictions.rationale: Upside inflation risks and supply dynamics can push term yields to 4.6%+ briefly.

predictions.text: COMEX Gold (GC) front-month futures will settle at or above $2,700 per troy ounce on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: CME Group official settlement price for the active COMEX Gold (GC) contract ≥ $2,700.00 by the deadline.
predictions.rationale: Central bank demand and geopolitical hedging can lift gold despite higher real yields.

predictions.text: USD/JPY (Yahoo Finance: JPY=X) will trade at or above 163.00 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Intraday high on Yahoo Finance JPY=X (or equivalent reputable source) shows ≥ 163.00 at any point by the deadline (UTC).
monitoring_signals: BoJ policy guidance and JGB yields
predictions.rationale: Wide rate differentials and cautious BoJ normalization keep upward pressure on USD/JPY.

predictions.text: U.S. refiner operable utilization rate will print at or below 87.0% in at least one EIA Weekly Petroleum Status Report published by 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: In any EIA Weekly Petroleum Status Report by the deadline, the 'U.S. Refiner Operable Utilization Rate (percent)' entry is ≤ 87.0%.
predictions.rationale: Autumn maintenance season typically depresses utilization into the mid-to-high 80s.

predictions.text: Apple (AAPL) fiscal Q4 2025 total net sales will be between $85.0B and $91.0B, per the company’s earnings release published by 2025-11-10.
predictions.verification_criteria: Apple Newsroom/Investor Relations earnings materials for quarter ended September 2025 report 'Total net sales' within [85.0, 91.0] billion USD.
predictions.rationale: Services growth and stable iPhone cycle offset China softness and FX variability.

predictions.text: NVIDIA (NVDA) Q3 FY2026 Data Center segment revenue will be between $27.0B and $30.0B, per the company’s earnings release or Form 10-Q published by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: NVIDIA’s Q3 FY2026 results disclose 'Data Center' segment revenue within [27.0, 30.0] billion USD.
monitoring_signals: Supply of H200/B200 and networking components
Export controls or data center demand shifts
predictions.rationale: Hyperscaler demand remains robust; supply constraints ease gradually, sustaining elevated run-rate.

predictions.text: China exports (YoY, USD terms) for September 2025 will print between -2% and +4% in the General Administration of Customs release by 2025-10-13.
predictions.verification_criteria: GAC China monthly trade release shows year-over-year change in exports (USD-denominated) for September 2025 within [-2%, +4%].
monitoring_signals: New export orders in official/Caixin PMIs
Global freight rates and TEU volumes
predictions.rationale: External demand is stabilizing but not booming; exports likely hover near flat YoY.

predictions.text: University of Michigan 1-year inflation expectations (final) for October 2025 will print between 3.0% and 3.5% in the release due 2025-10-25.
predictions.verification_criteria: University of Michigan Surveys of Consumers final October 2025 'Expected change in prices during the next 12 months' reading is within [3.0%, 3.5%].
predictions.rationale: Near-term expectations have anchored near ~3.2% amid steady gas prices and cooling core.
